dt: {bc}a profession for which one trains and which is undertaken as a permanent calling
{bc}a field for or pursuit of consecutive progressive achievement especially in public, professional, or business life
used especially in the phrases {phrase}in full career{/phrase} or {phrase}at full career{/phrase}

dt.t: The trumpets sounded, and the knights charged each other {wi}in full career{/wi}.

et: Middle French {it}carriere{/it}, from Old Occitan {it}carriera{/it} street, from Medieval Latin {it}carraria{/it} road for vehicles, from Latin {it}carrus{/it} car
shortdef: a profession for which one trains and which is undertaken as a permanent calling —often used before another noun
a field for or pursuit of consecutive progressive achievement especially in public, professional, or business life
speed in a course —used especially in the phrases in full career or at full career

dt: {bc}to go at top speed especially in a headlong manner

shortdef: to go at top speed especially in a headlong manner

dt: {bc}the series of progressively higher positions that can be attained in one's working career conceived of as a ladder to be climbed toward greater responsibility and financial success

dt.t: … a twentysomething heroine working her way up the {wi}career ladder{/wi} …
The more skills you acquire and use, the more you can earn – even if you don't jump to the next rung on the {wi}corporate ladder{/wi}.
Like most successful women in the pop-music industry, Rhone, 42, started off answering phones and watching men climb the {wi}corporate ladder{/wi} to success.

… the kind of resentment that a man who has spent his life climbing the ranks of a large bureaucracy feels toward a man who leapfrogs up the {wi}career ladder{/wi} through a special and obnoxious blend of deferments and degrees.

Today as vice-president and director of global diversity, she works with the office of the CEO to ensure that women and people of color with the potential to move up the {wi}corporate ladder{/wi} are identified and groomed.

shortdef: the series of progressively higher positions that can be attained in one's working career conceived of as a ladder to be climbed toward greater responsibility and financial success

dt: {bc}a person who has committed many crimes throughout his or her life

shortdef: a person who has committed many crimes throughout his or her life

dt: {bc}something done to help a person's career

shortdef: something done to help a person's career
